learning_outcomes.description: Explain and discuss the principles of wastewater surveillance including the prerequisite for its application.
Examine the advantages and limitations of wastewater surveillance compared to traditional forms of surveillance.
Critically apply wastewater surveillance methods to different scenarios in Australia and around the world.
Use wastewater surveillance to examine and develop responses a range of public health questions.
Demonstrate skills in research, communication (written, oral and digital), group work/collaboration and reflection.

assessments.task_description: To develop skills as a reflective, evidence-informed public health practitioner, participants will present a 2-minute vlog (video log) that reflects on key points learnt from the content and activities delivered in the course each day. Vlogs must be submitted before midnight each day which attracts a two percent (2%) mark. No marks will be received for non-submission. General class feedback will be provided the following morning.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Please refer to the Policies and guidelines
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
To develop evidence-based arguments discussing your allocated debate topic. Each speaker has five (5) minutes to influence the audience. A written summary of your arguments of 500 words is to be provided at the conclusion of your debate. The debate presentation and written presentation is weighted 30% in total. This percentage will consider key aspects such as:

  • your individual debate
  • the overall debate quality (i.e., the overall quality and fit of your debate section within the wider team debate)
  • written summary of your arguments


This is a group task, however an individual mark will be awarded.

Information on debating will be provided to all students. Read full task description.

assessments.task_description: To produce a written personal meta-reflection of 500 words describing what you have learnt throughout the week and how your thinking has changed.

assessments.task_description: Working individually, participants will be allocated a wastewater surveillance scenario and then be required to draw on the knowledge developed through the PUBH7050 course to evaluate and critically apply this scenario to develop an implementation plan response. Once the assessment is commenced, you will have a defined period of time within which to complete the wastewater surveillance implementation plan.
